block.p: Jessica Alanna Wachter, the daughter of Susan and Michael L. Wachter of Berwyn, Pa., was married on Monday to Michael Jacob Kahana, a son of Eva and Boaz Kahana of University Heights, Ohio. Rabbi Alan J. Iser officiated at the Rittenhouse Hotel in Philadelphia.

Ms. Wachter, 26, is keeping her name. She graduated magna cum laude from Harvard University, where she is a doctoral candidate in business economics. In September, she is to become an assistant professor of finance at New York University's Stern School of Business.

Jessica Alanna Wachter, the daughter of Susan and Michael L. Wachter of Berwyn, Pa., was married on Monday to Michael Jacob Kahana, a son of Eva and Boaz Kahana of University Heights, Ohio. Rabbi Alan J. Iser officiated at the Rittenhouse Hotel in Philadelphia.

Ms. Wachter, 26, is keeping her name. She graduated magna cum laude from Harvard University, where she is a doctoral candidate in business economics. In September, she is to become an assistant professor of finance at New York University's Stern School of Business.

The bride's father is the William B. Johnson professor in the law of economics at the University of Pennsylvania Law School. Her mother is the assistant secretary of policy development and research at the Department of Housing and Urban Development in Washington; she is on leave from Penn's Wharton School of Business, where she is a professor of real estate and finance.

Mr. Kahana, 31, is an associate professor of psychology and neuroscience at Brandeis University in Waltham, Mass. He graduated from Case Western Reserve University and received a doctoral degree in psychology from the University of Toronto. His mother is the Pierce T. and Elizabeth D. Robson professor of humanities at Case Western, where she is also the chairwoman of the sociology department. His father is a professor of psychology at Cleveland State University.
